purpose: Truth constraints to prevent hallucination, exaggeration, and false architectural claims
never_claim: That g3d provides a full 3D engine with scenes, physics, or animation
That g3d includes a scene graph or hierarchical transform system
That g3d supports deferred rendering, PBR, or advanced lighting models
That g3d handles skeletal animation or skinning
That g3d uses GPU-side matrices or shader buffer objects for transforms
That g3d performs frustum culling or occlusion testing automatically
That g3d supports instancing without user-managed meshes
That OBJ loader supports materials (MTL) or texture coordinate transformations
That collisions are continuous physics-based; they are mathematical intersection tests only
That g3d maintains global shared state other than shader uniform bindings
That g3d performs memory management automatically (Lua GC is not a managed resource identity system)
That any g3d API performs asynchronous or threaded operations
That camera supports inertia, smoothing, or cinematic curves (unless user adds them)
never_infer: That the coordinate system is left-handed (it is right-handed Z-up)
That mesh compression uses FFI unless explicitly enabled
That OBJ loader validates correctness of mesh winding order
That any module allocates tables for vectors (vectors are 3-number return values)
That camera look modes imply global orientation conventions not present in code
That collisions return full diagnostic info — they only return hit positions or boolean values
truth_rules: Do not invent functions not present in the bundle
Do not add fields to model, camera, or matrix tables that are not explicitly defined
Do not assert existence of features not confirmed by code or semantic.json
Do not upgrade mathematical precision (e.g., double precision matrices) without explicit user request
Do not modify vector or matrix representations in examples or explanations
Do not reference external dependencies beyond LÖVE APIs used in the bundle

claim_requires_evidence: Any statement about rendering pipeline behavior
Any statement about the internal layout of matrices or vectors
Any statement about collision algorithm correctness or complexity
Any statement about camera projection math
